intro: Microlicia mutabilis, commonly known as the variable microlicia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, palmate leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
